# Welcome

**World Development Indicators (2022)**  
*An overview of global economic and social trends* 


# GDP per Capita
Overview
- Large differences across countries  
- High skewness toward wealthy nations  
- Commonly analyzed on a **log scale**

```{python}
import pandas as pd, matplotlib.pyplot as plt, numpy as np

df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
x = df["gdp_per_capita"].dropna()

plt.hist(np.log10(x[x>0]), bins=25, color="steelblue", edgecolor="white")
plt.title("GDP per Capita (log10 scale, 2022)")
plt.xlabel("log10(USD)")
plt.ylabel("Count")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
Observation:
Income distribution is highly skewed — most countries earn below $20,000 per capita,
while a few advanced economies pull the upper tail.



# Life Expectancy and Income
- Strong positive relationship between income and health
- Diminishing returns at high income levels




::: {.stretch}       
```{python}
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 7
#| fig-dpi: 160
#| out-width: 100%
#| fig-align: center

plt.figure(figsize=(12,7))
gdp_le = df[["gdp_per_capita","life_expectancy"]].dropna()
plt.scatter(np.log10(gdp_le["gdp_per_capita"]), gdp_le["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.7)
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita (2022)")
plt.xlabel("log10(GDP per Capita, USD)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.grid(True, linewidth=0.3)
plt.show()

```
Observation:
We see a clear positive relationship, but life expectancy increases at a slower rate among wealthier nations.



# Inflation and Growth
- Weak negative correlation between inflation and growth
- High outliers cause instability

```{python}
if "gdp_growth_rate" in df.columns:
    infl = df[["inflation_rate","gdp_growth_rate"]].dropna()
    plt.scatter(infl["inflation_rate"], infl["gdp_growth_rate"], alpha=0.7)
    plt.title("GDP Growth vs Inflation (2022)")
    plt.xlabel("Inflation rate (%)")
    plt.ylabel("GDP growth (%)")
    plt.grid(True, linewidth=0.3)
    plt.show()

```
Observation:
Cross-sectional data shows no strong link between inflation and growth —
temporal or panel data would provide better insights.



# Conclusion
Key Takeaways

- Income disparities remain vast across nations.

- Life expectancy rises with income, but plateaus at the top.

- Inflation-growth relationships are weak cross-sectionally.
